meanings.definition: A hypothetical force formerly thought to pervade all nature and to be the cause of various natural phenomena.
meanings.sent1: The ancient people believed in the power of od to control the world around them.
meanings.sent2: Scientists once pondered the existence of od as a universal energy.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled, imagining od as a magical force that made the trees dance.
meanings.sent4: In stories, od was depicted as a mystical thread connecting all living things.
meanings.sent5: The concept of od lingered in folklore, shaping tales of wonder and mystery.

meanings.definition: A hypothetical force formerly thought to be responsible for many natural phenomena, such as magnetism.
meanings.sent1: Long ago, people attributed the pull of magnets to the mysterious od.
meanings.sent2: The ancient texts spoke of od as the unseen force behind magnetic attraction.
meanings.sent3: The idea of od controlling magnets seemed like a whimsical notion.
meanings.sent4: Metaphorically, od was likened to the invisible hand guiding metal objects.
meanings.sent5: The concept of od added an element of enchantment to the study of magnetism.

meanings.definition: A hypothetical force formerly thought to be responsible for many natural phenomena, such as magnetism.
meanings.sent1: In folklore, od was said to be the secret behind the magic of magnets.
meanings.sent2: The ancient philosophers debated the nature of od and its connection to magnetism.
meanings.sent3: Children's stories often featured od as the mischievous force behind magnetic tricks.
meanings.sent4: The concept of od was like a hidden hand guiding the dance of magnetic fields.
meanings.sent5: Legends wove tales of od as the silent force shaping the behavior of magnets.
